thread.title: Saints vs Eagles Official Injury Report
thread.title_full: Saints vs Eagles Official Injury Report

author: Scott Prather
title: Saints vs Eagles Official Injury Report
text:
Saints vs Eagles Official Injury Report By Scott Prather October 9, 2015 5:13 PM Share on Twitter Photo by Christian Petersen/Getty Images 
The New Orleans Saints (1-3) battle the Philadelphia Eagles (1-3) this Sunday in Philly at noon. While each team is in a “must win” situation, neither will be playing with a fully healthy team. 
Saints starting left tackle Terron Armstead (knee) is officially listed as OUT for the game, as is punter Thomas Morstead (quad). 
New Orleans signed punter Brandon Fields this week to fill in while Morstead recovers from his right quadriceps injury. 
Guard Jahri Evans (knee) is questionable, and has missed the previous two games. Also questionable is rookie defensive lineman Bobby Richardson (hip). 
New Orleans guard Tim Lelito (back) is listed as probable, as his safety Jarius Byrd (knee) and cornerback Keenan Lewis (hip). 
With Armstead sidelined Sunday, rookie first round pick Andrus Peat is poised to make his first career NFL start. 
For Philadelphia, the following players are out: linebacker Kiko Alonso (knee), defensive end Brandon Bair (groin) and linebacker Mychal Kendricks (hamstring). 
Eagles starting offensive tackle Jason Peters (quadricep) is questionable, though he is expected to play according to multiple reports. 
Philadelphia safety Chris Maragos (quadricep), defensive end Cedric Thornton (hand) guard Allen Barbre (groin), defensive end Taylor Hart (shoulder), offensive tackle Lane Johnson (Knee) and cornerback Byron Maxwell (Quadricep) are all probable.
